processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joan Dassin is an educator, scholar, and former foundation executive who worked for a number of years at the Ford Foundation. Dassin originally worked in the Ford Foundation's program for Latin America before becoming Director of its International Fellowships Program.

Dassin's career at the Ford Foundation began in its program for Brazil where she worked as a Program Officer before becoming the Foundation's Representative for Brazil. In 1992, she was appointed Regional Director for Latin America and the Caribbean. She later worked as a Consultant to the Ford Foundation Office for the Andean Region and the Southern Cone. From 2000 to 2013, she directed the Foundation's International Fellowships Program.

After leaving the Ford Foundation, Dassin became a professor of international education and development at the Heller School for Social Policy and Management. Dassin earned a B.A. in English and American literature from Brandeis University and a Ph.D. in modern thought and literature from Stanford University.
